text:
Narendra "Bull" Kumar, PVSM, KC, AVSM, (also spelled "Narinder"; (8 December 1933 – 31 December 2020) was an Indian soldier-mountaineer. He was deputy leader of the first Indian successful Everest Expedition in 1965.
In 1965, Narendra was awarded Padma Shri, the fourth highest civilian award in India, and Arjuna Award
for the first Indian successful Everest Expedition in 1965.
